result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

08:52 AM Attorney Justin L. Singleton in court.   Defendant Marlana J Socha did not appear.   Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for plea and sentencing.  
Defense has no indication of their clients whereabouts.  State requests a capias; bail revoked and forfeited.
Defense requests a stayed capias.  
Based on defendant's non-appearance Court orders capias - Branch 12 only.  Court orders bail revoked and forfeited.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:14 AM Defendant Marlana J Socha in court with attorney Justin L. Singleton.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Jury Status hearing.  

Court notes the matter is set for jury trial to begin next week and inquires as to the status of the case.  Atty. Singleton advises parties have reached a resolution and is asking the matter be set for plea and sentencing; as a result the jury trial next week can come off the calendar.  Atty. Woller confirms.  Court will remove the jury trial from the calendar and set the matter for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
